title: Wightman enjoys first Scottish title in 10 years
title_page: Wightman enjoys first Scottish title in 10 years - BBC Sport
maintext:
Jake Wightman has his sights on the European Indoors and the World Indoors after collecting his first Scottish title for 10 years.
The 2022 world champion over 1500m has raced just 10 times in two years following a series of injuries.
Wightman, 30, powered to victory over 3,000m in Glasgow on Saturday in a championship-best time of seven minutes 44.94.
"I am delighted with that run and my time as I was looking to be around the 7:50 mark," he told Scottish Athletics.
"It is my first Scottish title in a long time and a big thank you to everyone who helped make it happen.
"I'm just so pleased to be racing again. It was my first since June and now the plan is to keep racing indoors and see if I can represent GB and NI at the Europeans and the World Indoors as well."
